Package gameobjects.nonstaticobjects

Class Hero

java.lang.Object
gameobjects.GameObject
gameobjects.nonstaticobjects.NonStaticObject
gameobjects.nonstaticobjects.Hero
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Gaper, Isaac, Magdalene
public class Hero
extends NonStaticObject
A hero is a NonStaticObject, it's the object that will be played by the player. So it uses a lot of unique variable, such as an integer attackSpeed, that represents how fast he can attack the monsters.

There's also the double reach, that's how far the projectile shot by the hero will go.

And the last one is the Item array Inventory, used to store every Item the player collects, the Hero's inventory only has two spaces and the Hero will drop the first item upon collecting an item if it's inventory's full.

It also has three integer variable, money, keys, bomb, used to know how many item of the same name the hero has.

They are also four different integer arrays, like itemCooldown, initialItemCooldownValue, itemDuration, initialItemDurationValue, That are used when an item can be used, to know how long the player has to wait before using it again and how long the effect will last.

There's some variable allocated to animation such as a String orientation to know where the hero is facing and a String legImagePath that represents the legs of the hero. To check what the other variable from Hero are please refer to NonStaticObject and GameObject.

See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Hero

      public Hero​(Vector2 position, Vector2 size, double speed, java.lang.String frontImagePath, java.lang.String backImagePath, java.lang.String sideImagePath, java.lang.String otherSideImagePath, int attackSpeed, double reach, double damage, double health)
      Constructs a new Hero, whose position and size are specified by the Vector2 argument and whose room is specified by the Room argument.

      It also affects the new Hero's maxHealth to same number as the health parameter.

      Parameters:
      position - the position of the new Hero
      size - the size of the new Hero
      speed - the speed of the new Hero
      frontImagePath - the image of the new Hero facing north
      backImagePath - the image of the new Hero facing south
      sideImagePath - the image of the new Hero facing est
      otherSideImagePath - the image of the new Hero facing west
      attackSpeed - the speed the new Hero will be attacking
      reach - the distance the projectile, shot by the new Hero, can travel before dying
      damage - the damage done by the new Hero
      health - the health of the new Hero

  • Method Details

    • updateGameObject

      public void updateGameObject()
      Updates Hero object movement. Also decreases the cooldowns used to attack, to know whether the Hero is hit, to know whether the hero is not walking, and the usable item re-use and duration cooldowns.

      If the itemDuration cooldown is equal to 1 then the item effect is removed.

    • animation

      public void animation()
      Used to make the legs of the Hero Move.
      Specified by:
      animation in class NonStaticObject

    • drawGameObject

      public void drawGameObject()
      Draws the Hero based on it's position, imagePath, size and degree. It draws the Hero's head first and then the legs.

      If a color is specified then it uses StdDraw.picture(double, double, String, double, double, double, Color, int) to draw a transparent filter of the color on top of the GameObject.

      Overrides:
      drawGameObject in class GameObject

    • legalMove

      public boolean legalMove​(Vector2 position)
      Checks if the move is legal or not, it checks if the Hero collides with a closed Doors, if it is then the move is considered not legal otherwise it continues through the other checks from NonStaticObject.legalMove(Vector2).

      If it is the move is legal it returns true, otherwise returns false.

      Overrides:
      legalMove in class NonStaticObject
      Parameters:
      position - , object position
      Returns:
      true if the move is legal, false otherwise.

    • goUpNext

      public void goUpNext()
      Adds one to the direction vector, also changes the image to match the direction.

    • goDownNext

      public void goDownNext()
      Adds one to the direction vector, also changes the image to match the direction.

    • goLeftNext

      public void goLeftNext()
      Adds one to the direction vector, also changes the image to match the direction.

    • goRightNext

      public void goRightNext()
      Adds one to the direction vector, also changes the sprite to match the direction.

    • attack

      public void attack​(Vector2 direction, Room room)
      Checks if the Hero can attack (cooldown is equal to 0). If it is, it creates a tear with the direction from the parameter at the Hero coordinates, and then sets the attackCooldown back to the attackSpeed.

      To check how the Tear is created go to Tear

      Parameters:
      direction - the direction which the tear will go
      room - the room the tear will be in

    • addInventory

      public GroundItem addInventory​(Item item)
      Adds an item into the Hero inventory, if the Item as the name "money", "key" or "bomb" then it will be added in the hero variable of the same name.

      Otherwise it adds the item in the inventory if the inventory still has some space in. Else it will drop the first item of it's inventory and add the new item to the inventory.

      Parameters:
      item - the item that'll be added to the inventory
      Returns:
      the GroundItem that is the item drop from the inventory.

    • dropInventory

      public GroundItem dropInventory​(int slot)
      Drops the Item linked to the slot if it exists. It will add the GroundItem, that represents the Item that was in the inventory, to the list of GroundItem.
      Parameters:
      slot - the slot the item will be dropped
      Returns:
      the GroundItem that is the item dropped from the inventory.

    • updateItemBonus

      public void updateItemBonus​(Item item)
      Updates the bonus effect from the item.
      Parameters:
      item - the item

    • removeItemBonus

      public void removeItemBonus​(int slot)
      Removes the itemBonus given by the item from the slot.
      Parameters:
      slot - the slot in the inventory

    • useItem

      public void useItem​(int slot)
      Uses the item from the slot in the inventory. And sets a cooldown for using it again, as well as a item effect cooldown.
      Parameters:
      slot - the slot of inventory

    • isFullyHealled

      public boolean isFullyHealled()
      Checks if the Hero has full health.
      Returns:
      true if it has, false otherwise.

    • drawHeroInfo

      public void drawHeroInfo()
      Draws every Hero information, such as the health, the amount of money, bomb and keys, and the objects in the Inventory.

    • getInventory

      public Item[] getInventory()
      Returns the Hero inventory.
      Returns:
      the Hero inventory.

    • setInteract

      public void setInteract​(boolean interact)
      Sets what state the Hero is in, whether can interact with something or not.

      if interact is set to true then the Hero will be able to interact, if it's set to false then the Hero will not be able to interact.

      Parameters:
      interact - the interact state

    • getInteract

      public boolean getInteract()
      Returns what state the Hero is in, whether it's interact or not.
      Returns:
      true if the Hero can interact, false otherwise.
